caption: Awesome food! The staff are super nice! The garlic knots are very greasy though! But everything else is perfect!!!
Drench with oil and no favor
Awesome food
Pizza is always fresh. They have a good assortment of pizza & pasta. Overall good pizza
Delicious pizza and speedy delivery. Ordered directly through the restaurant website and got a discount. Great place!
Really great pizza. I love the BBQ deep dish slice.
great restaurant with good options, but pizza's a little greasy and also a little expensive
Im not a pizza lover however their pizza is good.

This used to be my go to for wine after work that's like 3 doors down. I overpayed $20 for my normal bottle of $15 wine on Monday. I called back after the guy agreed to let me pay $10 over the phone. Tonite, on Thursday I went back he pretended he didn't kno who I was. I buy my wine from him at least twice a week if not more. Hurt feelings are an understatement. I won't be going back, this is how he treated me as regular for more than a year. Terrible customer service.
Great food and service!!

I called and asked for their 2 pie special which includes a Free 2 Liter soda, this special is advertised on their menu and on their website. They said that I have to literally have a paper menu, cut out the coupon and present it to them lol. What year is this 1996? In an era of smart phones and apps, I can literally place an order for pizza with the touch of a button on my phone, who the hell still uses coupons? I feel bad for these old school business, they are still in the Stone Age. Then they wonder why they are going out of business.

I used to go to school across the street from these guys and we used to get Pizza for lunch. I'm old now but I still get my Pizza here. It's a reason to get out of bed. I love it. A Park Slope Landmark.
Good food. Many different types of pizza. Fast friendly service. My goto pizza spot when I am in the area.
The atmosphere is outstanding, the customer service is great, and the food was amazing. I definitely recommend them to everyone I know!

I love the pizza here! Although when we got ours it took about 5-10 minutes to actually get the pizza. It seemed like the workers got a bit distracted. Other than that it was great. Nice outdoor seating and like I said great pizza
The speciality pizza (sesame crust pizza with basil pesto) is spectacular.
I ordered 2 slices and I have never had a more soggy pizza. The Sicilian vegetable topping cust was so wet I though it was dipped in water.
Solid pizza and knots, baby onion pies are great, they've got some decent beer and wine, and they're open later then any of the other good pizza around. Big fan.
It's good
I grew up eating at this place. I use to live at 431 1st between 6th & 7th avenue. And I just love the pizza and the area.
Far from me but they always deliver. Literally the BEST pizza to me in NYC, and I've lived in the city for 15+ years

Our experiences have mostly been with take-out. They have a friendly staff, they are clean, efficient, and pretty fast.  We order fairly frequently, found the food to be really good, and have been enthusiastic about everything we ever ordered. Our orders have included the dinners, the side orders, the wraps, the rolls, and of course the pizza. We are still exploring their extensive menu.
one of those old school places.  Reminds me of the 80s local pizza joints.  great pizza

I admittedly haven't eaten there in 20 years, but when I had the Pizza it was among the best I've ever had.  At the time I was living on Park Place off of Flatbush.  We used to get Pino's twice a week and it always blew our minds!  The owner was super nice as well and gave us free Pizza the first night we moved into the neighborhood and were walking by.
Nice pizza very tasty; nice variations; WAY OVERPRICED!!!
The best
Best pizza on 7th ave
Great pizza! Their meat special is fantastic. Good selection, nice oven, food is good. Patties, wings and other things to add.
Pizza is amazing!
best.pizza in brooklyn  on location for the shooting movie the marriage
Best pizza! Amazing service! Highly recommend!
Best in Brooklyn
Great customer service. Rushed over a replacement for an incorrect delivery order. And the toppings were excellent.
I wayy overpaid for a pan pizza (24$) that Pizza Hut and Dominos beat easily, and a salty, fishy tasting calamari that was forgotten and came on a delivery 40 minutes later.
Been coming here since high school - delicious pizza and classic pizza place atmosphere. Perfect New York pizza. 👌🍕
I was looking for a place to eat around the holidays and this was the only restaurant opened in the area.The pizza is average otherwise the place was welcoming
Good and cheaper than other places in the area
If you're looking for a typical slice of real NY pizza, look no further.

Dont go around lunch time. Their is a junior high school across the street and a highschool up the block. All the kids come here and make it impossible for you to sit and eat. Overall, the food is great
Corner slice of Sicilian with extra cheese. Heaven.
Longtime neighborhood mainstay for old school pizza. Light-crust Sicilian a favorite.
Hold on. They take credit cards and serve alcohol now? Buffalo chicken ranch? 7 stars playboy

I was shocked recently when Pino’s took back a pizza that had been sitting in my home for over half an hour. They sent the wrong order at first and then sent the correct order when I called them. Of course, it was an inconvenience but I have less of a problem with that. I’m concerned though about the food safety and sanitary factor. One wonders if returned food from any restaurant goes on to another customer. Just concerning regarding health code.
Pizza was really good......

I live in Queens, NY, and I come all the way to Brooklyn just for this pizza. I absolutely love the taste of it and no where else in Queens compares. Anytime someone asks me “where’s the best pizza you’ve ever had?”  PINO’S!
For Brooklyn pizza, there is way better
Great Place Good People
(Translated by Google) Excellent pizzas, typical, fast, very nice neighborhood  (Original) Excellente pizzas, typique, rapide, quartier très sympa
Good local pizza and calzones.

First time trying Vegan pizza. The "cheese" was slimy and wet so much so that it was sliding off the pizza when I picked up the first slice. The texture and taste were so off and disgusting I threw away the rest of the pie after 2 pieces.  Not even 30 minutes later, I had the runs! Never again. I could've just eaten regular cheese for all the trouble.
Yummy for the tummy
Great service and pizza
Great atmosphere, good food, friendly staff
Love it
Delicious pizza. Consistent. I travel from Manhattan to eat pizza there.
Fantastic pizza, my new go-to delivery place, that said, you guys gotta be more careful with the pizza, I order a large pizza the other day and I was scraping half the cheese off the side of the box.

It does my heart a world of good to see that you guys are still in business. As a woman in her 30's you were my very first pizza when I was 4 years old and despite what other people may think I'm overjoyed that you haven't changed your interior at all. Very few people in this area have staying power, I know you guys have proven time and time again that you deserve to be here. I remember when going out to lunch while attending school across the street was a huge deal, and all of the cool kids came here. 😆 I just wish you guys had gluten free crust!

I always order from this pizzeria, but my husband and I decided to stop by since we were out and it got late. Since we were not far and Pino's La Forchetta closes late we ate there and like always, it never disappoints 😉 I spoke to the person who takes the orders and he remembers me, he actually remembered the apartment number. Very friendly place.
Great pizza
Pizza is good. However prices are too high We are in brooklyn not soho...!!!!

When i got to the counter to place my order i had to wait for the employees to finish their conversation before they took my order. I grabbed the table closed to me, which happened to be dirty. I figured maybe i just missed rush since that pizzeria is popular with the school kids ?

My favorite pizza spot in the world. Everything on the menu is tasty, service is always swift and courteous. Been dining here for almost five years and I'm enjoying seeing them get more popular (and busier). I cannot recommend more.
THE PIZZA IS AWESOME!!
had the creamed spinach pizza
Classic Italian Eatery. I come for the pizza and calzones. Friendly staff. Decent prices for Park Slope.

I've been coming to this spot - NO JOKE - for over 30 years. I grew up in the Slope, so this was a pizza go to. I moved to LA, but when I come back home to visit the fam, I ALWAYS come back to Pino's. Real NY pizza right here. Getchu some!
Been coming here since 1988.   Still my favorite pizza in NY
Local pizza joint. Not the best pie, no hipster ingredients or home made cheese, but fresh and fast with a genuine Brooklyn feel.
Best pizza in Brooklyn !
Great Pizza, Surprisingly good French fries.
I love going here at my lunch break the pizza is good, and the guys there are friendly

The pizza is yum & served real quick. My friend preferred more sauce on his pizza, but I found mine just fine. An order of wings came out real good & side salad with grilled chicken hit the spot just right.
Good pizza, but it wasn't fresh from the oven because it was late. A bit dry and they didn't heat it long enough.
Been eating since I was a kid. Still love it.
Friendly staff, great food, decent prices. They take card and cash.
Place is a rip off overpriced and puts the large rolls in the front so when u ask they hand you the smallest f-ing thing always ask to see the food before they cook it they will try to rip you off
This is real N.Y.C. pizza at it's finest. Large, hot, juicy slices on a thin crust with heaps of melted cheese and a lovely red sauce, as my husband says: It doesn't get better than Pino's

Been going here since my little one was little. great food. Comfortable atmosphere. My little one is a teen now so when we were in the neighborhood we stopped in and it still has the same great flavor.
The pizza was OK, it was not anything I will go back for. We got 3 plains slices and it was the right temperature, smell and look but the taste was nothing special.
I've been coming here since I was a kid and they always have amazing pizza and other food
Sooooo good! My 11 month old son fought me for my slice,  lol.  You'll enjoy!
The pizza is delicious !!!😀🍕
A taste of NY.
My grandmother lives in Park Slope, and every time my family goes to visit, this is our first stop. Always delicious!
Been coming here since I was a little girl and I see they still teach a good way to make a great pizza Pino's number one always!
Nice people. Good pizza
Pizza is always good
Basic pizzaria
I loved this place for the food, ambience and service. I want to eat here much more often.

This is the place I always think about when I miss Brooklyn and pizza (I'm in England now) I visited recently and stopped in for a slice and my favorite baked ziti--still sublime--been excellent since childhood for me. The restaurant is nothing fancy, but if you want delectable italian -this is the place to go--sounds like delivery issues are causing problems (from the reviews) too bad it reflects on the restaurant as their food is as excellent as ever. Think about opening a place in Norwich England--we really need one here!
Great "cheap for the neighborhood" Italian comfort food place
Best pizza in the neighborhood hands down
Great pizza. Great atmosphere
I LOVE THERE FOOD, AND THEY ARE VERY NICE TO CUSTOMERS ENJOY!!
Great little family spot. Quick slice. Fresh. Friendly. Decent prices.
Decent neighborhood pizzaria
Good pizza, but was barely lukewarm when we finally (over an hour for delivery) got it.
So many good traditional Italian dishes and Foods.
In a neighborhood with some very good pizza options, pinos ranks at the top. Order the sicilian pie and thank me later. Perfection!
I love pizza. Most pizza is disappointing. Pinos is spectacular. Especially at midnight. Ices are delicious but a pint is not enough. Go to pinos, every damn day.
A little awkward as a place to actually eat but the pizza is great.
Fast service. Good pizza.
Best Pizza spot in Brooklyn! Hands down!
It's absolutely the BEST slice you'll ever have!!!
(Translated by Google) Good service and place to relax  (Original) Buen servicio y lugar para relajarse
I used to go here when I had my first job babysitting a girl who attended 282 across the street. Great pizza, great family feel.
This pizza parlor makes good pizza and eggplant parmesan heros. The staff is friendly, but there is a terrible draft coming from the front door. They need one of those add on entrances.
Best place ever, friendly staff
Always my favorite slice since 1970

WORST PIZZERIA AROUND! They treat there workers horrible. I saw the owner which I thought was a nice guy yelling at one of the delivery drivers because they got into an accident and fired him in front of the customer I mean show the kid some respect. Also they rob from there customers sometimes when they deliver they say they have no change and take all of as a tip.
A classic Brooklyn pizza place

Pino's is the best pizza joint in Brooklyn. (Yes even compared to L&B's, though they're a close 2nd) The marinara sauce is so tasty and the dough has a perfectly balanced crisp bottom and fluffy upper. The cheese is still perfectly stringy after being heated up no matter how long it's been sitting out! >.< Sit here long enough and you'll see your fair share of "real Brooklyn": kooks, locals, families, kids. #nohipsters
Clean
(Translated by Google) Good service and attention  (Original) Buen servicio y atencion
Great place awsome staff
3rd favorite pizza spot.
The pizza was great! Service, not so much.
Pizza was overly greasy. Dining room was not very clean. Quality not much better than a dollar slice place at 3x the price.
Great pepperoni pizza
great food but its sometimes sloppy cheese were it falls off
The grandma slice is a SLICE OF DELICIOUS BUTTERY HEAVEN! One of the best pizzerias in Brooklyn and prob the best in Park Slope. Go! Go! Go!
Good guys good pizza and great canollis
Service & Food was great! One of the best pizzas.
bestttt pizzaa i had you guyss are thee besttt
Good food, and good customer service. Everything is clean.

Every time I had a pizza slice , chicken roll Or beef patty from this place it has been delicious there chicken sandwich on there own roll is amazing .. Would give 5 stars but I havent had enough of there menu items to go 2 a 5 star rating
Great service, delicious pizza!
Always order from them!

Both due to sentimental value and quality of food, I am giving Pino's five stars. This was my childhood pizza place- I went to PS321 and it was a staple. I grab a slice periodically still when I'm in the slope, and it's still good.
Good food and great service!
A good old fashioned pizza place that's been there since before time
Long established basic pizza parlor.  Friendly service.
Great New York pizza by the slice
I love there pizza! Every year when I visit NY I have to get my pizza fix and they have the best pizza.
It's like dipping your toes in a warm bath of excellence.
Great service and great food.
Popular neighbourhood pizza place, one of the better ones here, but nothing to phone home about
There may be better pizza in Park Slope, but you're going to pay A LOT more. Best regular price pizza in PS, with a great old school pizzeria atmosphere.
Avoid the buffalo chicken pizza the worst I had eaten in my life last week ( sept 3 2016)
Best pizza I've found so far in Park Slope. The vodka sauce is great. And the garlic knots are a great appetizer at $2 for 6.
Delicious, filling chicken (Buffalo & BBQ) slices!
Pizza is the best, and the ices are so freaking delicious
Favorite by-the-slice pizza in the neighborhood.  Extra cheesy!

Pretty bad pizza. Only pizza I've had in New York that was worth was a dollar slice. These are two-fifty but not worth even that.  The place has a diner aesthetic with a creepy number of mirrors. They lead to a self-conscious feeing because they show you in a little too much detail...
This is my favorite New York style pizzeria. Always friendly. Over the last 30 years I've always loved this place.
Solid traditional New York style pizza,
Great staff and amazing pizza. Although I typically go for simple slice of pepperoni, the chicken bacon ranch pizza is incredible.
Amazing pizza
Had a slice of White pizza with spinach for 3.75, delicious.
You gmt

They used to be great but seem to have stopped caring. A couple orders ago it took almost 2 hours for the food to arrive and I got nothing but a "sorry, nothing we can do" when I called. This time I ordered a chicken parm hero which arrived extremely overcooked, and had bones in it. Actual bones. Not even joking. Repeated issues of this severity from my primary pizza place takes them off my list. I'll be looking for a new pizza place.
Best place ever!

I live on 7th Avenue and am a foodie.  This place is like the "Soup Nahtzee" off pizza places in the slope. Theres one guy whos kind of a jerk. If hes not working it increases the score half a star.  Ok that being said.  Best Meatball in Park Slope Best Garlic Knots in Park Slope Pretty good pizza.  Environment is kind of campy so my wife and i prefer to take it home or have it delivered.

Usually the pizza is very good, but today I got it with Meatballs on top. Inside of the meat i found a small fang!!!! I don't know if it was a rat, but I still can't think what did I eat. I am going to submit a complaint to FDA.
I got my pizza with an extra topping HAIR!!!

Horrible pizza!!! I tried them 3 times and it took them more than an hour to deliver each time; I live 5-10 min driving distance. The last time they drop my pizza and still brought it to me. When I called with a complain, they refused to refund me for it and I heard how they where making fun of me in a different language that I happen to know. I give them 0 stars and will never buy from them again!
Woohoo. Thank-you very much. Mission accomplished
This place has been around forever! its amazing! you should so try the chicken and tomato pizza! but anything on the menu is amazing!

As a Brooklynite I am able to understand the minute differences between pizza joints. This is one of the best. They make a perfect slice - not too thin, not too thick, never burnt, sized well, flavorful sauce and not overly salty. They also do a great sicilian. Trying the rest of their menu can be hit or miss but they make a very hearty whole wheat pizza and a delicious calzone or spinach/chicken roll. Grab a slice and chat with the pizza guy and feel cool.
One of the best pizza places in Park slope, delicious
